intro: Commelina karooica, commonly known as the Karoo commelina, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Commelinaceae, which includes grass-like plants and some aquatic species. The plant typically grows in open, grassy areas and has narrow, grass-like leaves. Its inflorescence consists of small, blue or white flowers arranged in a spike. Commelina karooica is often found in sandy or rocky soils and is adapted to arid conditions.
